document.docAuthor: Liu, Zhen, He, Jun-Hua, Chen, Xue-Xin & Gupta, Ankita
document.masterDocTitle: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

bibRefCitation.author: Nixon, G. E. J.
bibRefCitation.refString: Nixon, G. E. J. (1965) A reclassification of the tribe Microgasterini (Hymenoptera: Braconidae). Bulletin of the British Museum (Natural History), Entomology Series, Supplement 2, 1 - 284.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Apanteles argiope Nixon, 1965: 85
. Holotype ♀ (examined)— South Africa [NHM, Figs 104a
1 –a
2
].
Papp, 1987: 435–456
;
Shenefelt, 1972: 445
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Redescription. Female. Body length 2.3 mm , fore wing length 2.6 mm .

Head. Weakly transverse in dorsal view, 1.9× as wide as long, 1.2× wider than mesoscutum. Vertex between eye and posterior ocellus slightly shiny with fine puncture. Temple dull with shallow and confluent punctures, strongly constricted apically. Face 0.8× as high as wide, slightly shiny with rather dense punctures, pubescent, inner margin of eyes subparallel. Ocelli small, posterior tangent to anterior ocellus hardly touching posterior ocelli, distance between fore and hind ocellus longer than diameter of hind ocellus, POL:OD:OOL=5.0:1.5:3.5. Antenna distinctly shorter than body length, weakly articulated, penultimate flagellomere 1.3× longer than wide.

Mesosoma. Length:width:height = 41.0:23.5:27.0. Disc of mesonotum slightly shiny, with coarse, dense punctures, interspaces between punctures smaller than diameter of puncture, punctures confluent at posterior end of notaulic courses, smooth and unsculptured medial-apically and parts along hind margin. Scutellar sulcus nearly straight, broad with sparse carinae in between. Scutellum shiny with shallow punctures, not wide posteriorly, median length slightly shorter than basal width. Lateral polished field of scutellum reaching half length of scutellum. Propodeum dull, rugose anterio-laterally, areola well defined with transversal carinae inside, V-shaped apically, with strong costulae, posterio-lateral fields with irregular carinae. Mesopleuron highly polished and with sparse punctures, anterior parts dull with dense and coarse punctures widely.

Legs. Hind coxa slightly shiny, surface slightly rough without punctures basally. Spines on outer side of hind tibia relatively sparse. Inner spur of hind tibia 2/5 length of hind basitarsus, outer spur 1/3. Basitarsus of hind leg as long as tarsomeres 2–4 combined.

Wings. Pterostigma 2.7× as long as its widest part. Vein 1-R1 as long as pterostigma, 1.7× as long as its distance from apex of marginal cell. Vein r arising from apex of pterostigma, strongly declined outwards and curved, as long as width of pterostigma, r 2.0× longer than vein 2-SR, indistinctly angled at junction, 2-M as long as 2-SR and 2-SR+M, slightly longer than 1-SR, m-cu as long as r. First discal cell of fore wing 1.4× wider than high. Second submarginal cell of hind wing 1.4× wider than high. Vein cu-a curved. Hind wing narrow, vein 1-M not shorter than distance between its distal extremity and apex of vannal lobe. Vannal lobe beyond its widest part straight, with short setae.

Metasoma. 1.2× longer than mesosoma. T1 parallel-sided, 2.4× longer than hind width, concave at basal third, turned-over part dull, strongly rugose, longitudinal channel shallow, and apical tubercle highly polished and smooth. T2 more or less rough with wrinkles, trapezoidal, 2.5× wider than long in the middle, nearly straight apically. T3 2.6× longer than T 2 in the middle. Tergites posterior to T2 highly polished, slightly shiny, and pubescent. Hypopygium longer than apex of metasoma. Ovipositor sheath as long as hind tibia, sparsely pubescent.

Colour. Body black, except tergites posterior to T2 dark brown. Tegula dark brown. Palpi (except darker basally) and spurs pale yellowish. Antenna and ovipositor sheath dark brown to black. Labrum and mandible dark brown. Legs dark brown to black, except fore and mid legs somewhat yellowish, hind trochanter and tibia yellow basally. Wing membrane hyaline, somewhat brownish, veins brown.

Host. According to literature,
Crocidolomia
sp. ( Nixon, 1965 ).

Distribution. China ( Fujian , Guangdong , Guangxi , Hainan , Yunnan , Zhejiang ) new record ; Australia , Fiji , India , Indonesia , Malaysia , Philippines , Singapore , South Africa , South Korea , Vanuatu .
